content: Watching Helldivers in action is great for crew morale. It's even better than a dissident execution.
Zero friendly fire incidents is the sort of statistical anomaly I welcome.
You've got the bots on the run! Or, you know, whatever they do.
Welcome back. Those friendly fire incidents were entirely unavoidable.
Roger that. Go ahead and pull them out.
Welcome back. That city is one step closer to freedom.
Not a single Helldiver lost on that mission. A result as glorious as it is atypical.
A victory for democracy.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. The super destroyer is yours.

Everyone knows Cyberstan has been a rehabilitation facility for the cyborg since the first Galactic War. What a lot of people don't realize is just how many patriotic citizens it takes to keep an operation like that afloat. We will avenge every last one of them.
A democratic day to you.
A cheer for the hell divs. Who, hello.
They say the other side of the wormhole was probably a galactic void. No stars, planets or anything for light years. Sounds perfect for the illuminate.ðŸ˜Š
An unmitigated success, aside from the below average sample collection, of course.
Our enemies couldn't take down even a single Helldiver today. You truly are invincible.
Every battle lost lets the illuminate closer to superear.
The illuminate could be monitoring my thoughts right now. die, squid scum, die, die, die.
Middia was a paradise once as close to perfect as you can get outside of super earth. Our enemies took that from us.ðŸ˜Š
Good luck out there, Helldiver.
Without more samples, this ship will continue to operate at sub-optimal effectiveness.
We almost had to pull out. I'm relieved we didn't.
A fast mission is a good mission.
Liberty rests on your shoulders, Helldiver. I know you can bear the weight.
Heldiver, what happened down there. Ha How could we lose Super Earth?
I wish I could see the look on the squid's faces, right before they explode.
A 100% survival rate. Very satisfying.
The sheer volume of spores coming out of this super colony... I've never seen anything like it. Our farms couldn't achieve half of this, even at peak output.
You know, the cost of one stratagem is more than most citizens make in a year. You can see why they only entrust them to helldivers.
The mission failed, but your return means we recovered our most invaluable asset.
The engineers filled the TCS tanks with enough termicide to last over a year. Should be easy enough to replenish, once all the terminates are dead.
Superear's population is concentrated in the megacities. That's where we'll be fighting.
An unfortunate outcome, but your return gives me hope.
Good work down there. Maybe the bots are starting to realize who they picked a fight with.
The gloom is estimated to be about 20 parsecs in diameter. So if we do the math, that means there's about 350 octadecillion spores. Nothing we can't handle.
I hear a new voting algorithm is coming soon, supposed to have even better candidate selection than the current one, if you can believe it.
They say nothing escapes a black hole, but the memories of our lost citizens, those are still with us.
Keeping things running around here isn't easy, but if that's how I can best serve liberty, I'll do it gladly.
, the illumininate are finally out in the open. Good, I prefer a head on fight.
The bots are proof that if you put enough ones and zeros together, you can threaten the entire galaxy.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. Now that you're here, the war is as good as won.
Good luck out there, Hilldiver.
A reward for our righteous efforts.
Maybe, maybe this is all part of the plan high commands plan, yes, it must be that's the only thing that makes sense.
The illuminate are going to wish they'd never come through that wormhole.
Hail, super Earth.
I authorized an extra serving of fruit salad for the crew. Today was a victory, and it's important to celebrate that.

I've heard there's some kind of secret super weapon being worked on by our top scientists. Not the ones who made the termicide, of course. They're all being interrogated for treason. Our other top scientists.
Well done. The citizens down there will feel safe again soon enough.
Well done.
Lots of friendly fire. Unfortunate, but undoubtedly necessary.

Once this cleanup operation's over, I'm hoping they'll keep the Helldivers active indefinitely, as a galactic patrol force. The automatons weren't much of a threat, but... you never know what else could be out there.
for freedom
They say the wormhole is threatening to explode those dirty squids and theyre dirty tricks.
Fewer bots, more freedom.
Democracy conquers all.
If the Terminids had stayed on the element 710 farms where they belonged, all this bloodshed could have been avoided.
Another perfect day to defend freedom.
I wonder what the service technician would say if they were here right now, Probably something like that could use some fixing. always such a delight.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. We can never have too many heroes fighting for peace.
Lots of friendly fire. Unfortunate, but undoubtedly necessary.
Greetings, Helldiver.
I have something for you, Helldiver.
Welcome back. We'll retake CyberStan in no time.
Mission accomplished without a single casualty. It's a good day for managed democracy.
Document images 144/1000 real-time translation. There is no day night cycle on these ships. I like to imagine it's always morning, and I still have a whole day to defend my freedom.
The more we fight, the more it becomes clear that our enemies will never accept our way of life. It's us or them.
From what I've read, the illuminate have managed to turn dark fluid into some kind of massive energy source. It's like their version of electricity, except evil.
Me? I'm the ship master of the super destroyer. I make sure you have everything you need to spread managed democracy to our enemies.
a loss of resources, but we will recover.
Mission accomplished, and quickly too.
You know, this destroyer has enough coordinates to level a small moon. I've done the calculations myself.
The democracy officer is the one with the eye patch. I wouldn't recommend asking how he got it.
Helldiver, a moment of your time, please.
Another step towards total eradication.
I've never felt as proud to be a part of Super Earth as I do right now. Citizens of all classifications are coming together to fight for managed democracy.
I can't wait to see the TCS in action! Giant towers all over the planet spewing bug-killing gas into the air? Logistics alone are a work of art.
Mission accomplished, Helldiver. One small step for democracy, one giant leap in the death count of our enemies.
Sometimes I forget that we're just one piece of the puzzle. Case in point, once we push back the bugs, the SEAF will take over, guarding the construction of the TCS. Everyone has their part.
If if we've lost Super earth, then no, I can't think about that.
We'll be generating fewer condolence letters than usual today.
Democracy conquers all.
Speed is the essence of war.
Another victory for democracy.
If the automatons had stuck to raiding the developing worlds on the galactic fringe, we might have let them live a little longer. Now, they're dead-bots walking.
Welcome back. The illuminate might be an advanced species, but they're no match for the hell divers.
, we have to stay strong for the crew.
The collateral damage you did to the city was well worth its defense, not to mention unavoidable.
Hell Diver, bring me back some squid guts.
Ah the squids will do anything to keep super Earth enslaved.
We will take back super earth. We have to.
Super Earth will never forget the Helldivers we lost today, nor the incremental gains their sacrifice achieved.
It's a good day when we lose so few helldivers.

I was just thinking, warping across the Federation like this would be impossible without Element 710. Which comes from the bugs themselves. Their own corpses are fueling the creation of more corpses. Something satisfying about that.
helldiverï¼Ÿ
This is the largest Helldiver mobilization we've seen since the first galactic war. Our enemies don't know what's coming.
Oh, I see you've secured some research samples. You can spend those at the terminal over there to upgrade the Super Destroyer. Get enough of them, and we'll see what this baby can really do.
Maybe we don't even need the TCS. You Helldivers seem to kill plenty of bugs just fine on your own.
The wormhole could kill billions of loyal citizens, but the illuminate don't care.
The Democracy Officer is here to optimize our citizenship. We're lucky. We should always strive to be the best citizens we can be.
Super Earth High Command has graced us with a sign of their approval.
I look forward to the service technician returning from their professional development training.
Professional development training is an essential part of every soldier's professional development.
You inspire me, Helldiver. You inspire us all.
You know, the problem with the bugs is that they're relentless expansionists. In their region of space, we've found them on nearly every planet we've settled.
Helldiver, stomp any bugs lately?
An unfortunate outcome, but your return gives me hope.
New super earth. Maybe I'll get to set foot there someday.
The Illuminate had been building this force forÂ  a00 years, fighting them was never going to be easy.
The illuminate have retreated. Now it's time to make them pay.
Don't mind me, Hedier. All the excitement is making me jittery.
The DS SS, it's like a super, super, super destroyer.
May you always have a vote.
h,The fewer cities we control, the harder the planet will be to defend.
I never doubted we'd save Super Earth not once.
I'm not sure what to make of these automatons. I'm sure they're no match for the Helldivers, but that's no reason for complacency.
Greetings
Keep killing those squids, Hedi.
ahâ€¦liberty
Yeah, the illuminator going down, it's only a matter of time.
Super earth, I don't believe it.
Hmm. Liberty.
This set us back, but I know you'll make it right.
We're with you all the way, Hediver, we won't stop until Super Earth is free.
Even though the first galactic war ended almost 100 years ago, we're still enjoying the freedom those heroes fought and died for. Maybe in another 100 years, our descendants will be doing the same.
The wormhole has been a threat for so long. It's almost hard to imagine a galaxy without it.
The illuminate have gone too far this time.
I look forward to learning High command's contingency plan involving the temporary loss of Superear Bull thinking that's why we trust in high command.
There's nothing sweeter than victory in the name of freedom.
We eradicated the ill at once. Guss it's time to do it again.
We tell stories about the Illuminate to children. About what happens if they don't vote. I never thought we'd encounter the real thing.
Keep up the good work, Helldiver. Once we win, the planets we're fighting over will finally be allowed to prosper, like the rest of the Federation.
Note to self, iron trousers.
Even though the first galactic war ended nearly a hundred years ago now, managed democracy has stayed vigilant, exactly for developments like these.
We'll always remember Meridia as it was before the terminate infestation. before the illuminate turned it into a wormhole.
A few more bots out of commission.
I've never been more proud to serve alongside you.
Soldiers make tough calls, and that sometimes means friendly fire.
They won't take Super earth. We won't let them.
Welcome back. Democracy's reach extends a bit further, thanks to you.
Stay vigilant, Helldiver. Complacency plays right into the hands of dissidents.
This mobilization isn't a moment too soon. We've had hand soap on half Russians for weeks.
Our home has been occupied for too long.
No friendly fire incidents.
Our enemies can fight as hard as they like, but freedom always wins.
The bots are simple enough. Little more than bits of metal welded to a gun and a CPU with a single overriding directive, kill.
You secured a lot of samples.
Welcome back.
New super earth. It's got a certain ring to it.
Well done! Lots of enemies killed and lots of samples to help us figure out how to kill even more.
Welcome back! Soon those bugs will be safely trapped behind an inescapable pit of warped space-time.
No friendly fire incidents.
Freedom is its own reward, but this doesn't hurt.
Helldiver, glad to have you on board.
The terminids can suffuse interstellar space with all the impenetrable spore clouds they want. Nothing can hide from liberty forever.
No more wormhole. No more worries.
Well done! One step closer to turning this planet we're orbiting into a black hole.
Cape looks extra sharp today, Helldiver.
New super earth is wonderful, but it isn't a replacement for superear because nothing can replace superear.
The TCS couldn't have failed at a worse time! CyberStand was practically ours!
Good work down there. They'll regret trespassing into our cities.
I knew that wormhole was trouble ever since the illuminate created it.
Helldiver, your performance has been recognized.
When I heard the hell divers were going to launch a bomb into the center of an unstable singularity, that's when I knew we were going to win.
The logistics involved in running the DSsS. I could think about it all day.
Here's the problem with the bots, Helldiver. Their whole society revolves around violence. If they actually won the war, they'd have no idea how to function.
Mission complete. Sample collection below average.
for freedom
We can't let the Illuminate do whatever they're doing.
Lots of enemies killed, lots of samples collected. That's a good mission in my book.
Every helldiver lost is an unspeakable tragedy. But this mission had fewer unspeakable tragedies
We might not know where the automatons came from, but I can tell you where they're gonna end up. Melted down for scrap.
I'll need to requisition some more hell pots.
We have to defend Superear.
help super earth
Well done! The enemy barely noticed our presence before we pulled out.
Super earth is our home, even if none of us have ever lived there before, we could someday. That's why we can't lose this fight.
The destroyer is mighty, but it's not Super Earth's greatest weapon. No, that is managed democracy, the one thing our enemies can never understand.
This will go down in the history books. The heroic helldis who saved Superear with the help of their intrepid shipmasters.
The crew is asking what happens to the Feration of Superearth without Superear. I don't know what to tell them.
The automatons are a good reminder to never get complacent. It's like I always say, military spending is always money well spent.
Welcome back. The Terminids you defeated will soon fuel the war effort.
the Super Destroyer is yours.
That'll teach the illuminate to pursue their strategic objectives.
A lot of dead bots down there.
We're with you, Heldiver, all the way.
All these samples will help fund upgrades to the Super Destroyer.
Hm, smellmells like squid guts in air. must have been a good mission.
Visual scan of deck complete.
It's a relief, knowing the wormhole is finally inert.
small fractions of the bug population are showing resistance to the termicide. This sort of thing is to be expected, of course.
This mission required fewer heroes to make the ultimate sacrifice than normal.
Super earth under attack. It doesn't seem real, does it.
Always good to have another hero on board.
I almost thought you wouldn't make it.
There's nothing sweeter than victory in the name of freedom.
How long have the illuminate been planning this, probably since they were eradicated?

Sorry about that emergency warp, Helldiver. Probably caught you off guard. The supercolony started imploding, and we had to get out of there before we got sucked into the black hole. We barely made it.
Another victory over the Terminated Scourge.
The enemies on the battlefield are one thing, but at least they're out in the open. It's the traitors among us I truly hate.
When I get exhausted, I just think of all the brave super-Earth colonists out there settling new planets. They do their part, and we do ours.
You're back quickly. Well done.
I don't know if those automatons were ever technically alive, but they're definitely dead now.
Plenty of new threats on the battlefield, but that didn't stop you.
We may not fully understand the wormhole, but that's never stopped us before.
Many sacrifices were made today. We will never forget.
Before the war, there was a fusion reactor meltdown on Marfak's moon. They say what's happening with the wormhole now is like that, except bigger.
Reports say the illuminate have changed quite a bit over the past 100 years. One thing that hasn't changed, though, they still hate freedom.
An entire planet compressed into an infinitesimally small point? Well, that's what happens when you resist the will of managed democracy.
greeting
It's a good day when we lose so few helldivers.
Welcome back! That termicide's so effective, you can almost forget that it's 100% safe for all other living things.
Another victory for democracy.
You inspire me, Helldiver. You inspire us all.
You know, even after all these years, we're still not sure how terminids travel between solar systems. That's why the TCS is so genius. Doesn't matter how they get there, if they're dead on arrival.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver.
Fewer bugs, more freedom.
We did it, Heldiver, Super Earth is free.
It's time for payback.
Well done down there. We can still save this planet.
Good work down there! Nobody invades super territory and gets away with it.
Watch your step, Helldiver. We've got Dark Fluid on board now. One thing goes wrong, and we'll all be spaghettified before we know it.
Let me know if you need anything.
That should help keep the bug population in check.
Nice and cold in here.
Good work collecting so many samples.
Helldiver, stomp any bugs lately?
Let me know if you need anything.
We're fighting two fronts, the Terminids on one side, the Automatons on the other.
The Terminids can stay in their little spore cloud as long as they want as far as I'm concerned. We'll be ready to kill them whenever they come out.
The gloom. What's going on in there?
Helldiver, successful missions are rewarded by Super Earth High Command. These resources can be used to make your destroyer even more powerful.
Ah, liberty.
We can't let the enemy take our cities from us.
Democracy conquers all.
Mission accomplished, and quickly too.
May Liberty guide you.
I'll need to requisition some more health pods.
A few more missions like that and Super Earth will be free.
I haven't set foot on Super Earth myself, but I've heard it's even more spectacular in person.

No one could have predicted the return of the illuminate. This is why I always say military spending should be at least twice what you think you need. Just in case a hundred year old alien species you thought was dead comes back.
I hear they've taken to calling the terminated spore cloud the Gloom. A little imprecise if you ask me.
I wonder what the automaton's plan on doing with all the cyborgs. Now that I think about it, I wouldn't put it past them to be working together. I never trusted those half human freaks.
We've received recognition from High Command.
I've rarely seen Liberty dispense so rapidly.
can't forget to check up on shuttle maintenance.
Now that was what I call a profitable use of resources.
Welcome back. Friendly fire is a necessary evil of war.
A reward for our righteous efforts.
We will fight on in the memory of those we lost.
One step closer to deterring the illuminate threat.
High Command has rewarded us.
Congratulations on completing training, Helldiver. You're in charge of this vessel now. The Democracy Officer awaits you on the bridge. Welcome to the Galactic War.
One step closer to deterring the illuminate threat.
Greetings, Helldiver.
I'd like to see the illuminate try to control my brain. They won't like what they find.
I thought we had a lot of planets when I was a kid, but we've settled dozens more since then. A few generations from now, and the entire Milky Way will be one united democracy.
greetings
The illuminate will regret attacking our home.
A step backwards. We must redouble our efforts.
Everyone knows the Illuminate were wiped out after the First Galactic War. The official records state it very clearly. They say, At the end of the war
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. We can never have too many heroes fighting for peace.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. Now that you're here, the war is as good as won.
We can't afford too many more failures like that Hediver, Not this time.
Our achievements do not go unrecognized.

I'm a little nervous having the dark fluid aboard the ship. Apparently, there's a non-zero chance it could destroy the whole galaxy. But then again, we lose Super Earth. What hope is there for the galaxy anyway?
We might not be able to stop the illuminate from reaching superearth, but that should slow them down.
The existence of high casualty missions implies the existence of low casualty missions. And we can take some solace in that.
With new superear established, it's only a matter of time until we reclaim superear.
I'd ask if you were gonna take a break, but I already know the answer. You and your fellow Helldivers inspire me every day.
This is the largest Helldiver mobilization since the first galactic war. Plenty of allies we can join up with.
Take back our home, Heldiver.
That should slow him down. Every second counts.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. The Galactic War needs you.
Mission complete without a single friendly fire incident. That will save paperwork.
If you've got any medals or super credits, you can spend them in the acquisition store. That's where they sell the fancy stuff.
Keep it up, and pretty soon there won't be any bots left. Just manage democracy.
hail super earth
We lost many good helldivers today.
Another victory over the Terminated Scourge.
Helldiver, glad to have you on board.
The election is coming up. Even in the midst of war, managed democracy stands strong.
Excellent work. If I didn't know you'd never received urban warfare training, I'd never have guessed.
It's official. Now, we're fighting the illuminate two, In addition to the bugs and bots, a three front conflict, just like the first galactic war. When will these aliens learn.
Nice job down there. Hopefully the colonists will be able to recover some of the scrap.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. I look forward to serving with you.
The squids thought they could attack Superear. They thought we'd let them get away with it. Well, think again, squids.
New superearth is our temporary capital and headquarters. We have to keep its location secret.
You have to get back down there. This is a battle. we can't lose.
hello
Welcome back. Well done.
Keep an eye out for more samples next time.
You might be wondering what happened to the service technician they're attending professional development training standard procedure.
Welcome back! Few more missions like that and we'll have the bugs quarantined in no time.
That'll teach the bugs to evolve.
We lost many good helldivers today.
After we retake Cyberstan, we'll turn over every asteroid in the galaxy until we find where the automatons came from.
We have to get back down there. The city needs us.
Some of the crew like to talk about what they'll do when the war is over. I don't allow that sort of thing. We need to focus on the fight.
A 100% survival rate. Very satisfying.
helldiver
Always good to have another hero on board.
More samples. Good. I'm looking forward to seeing what destroyer upgrades you can get for them.
Looks like the illuminate are trying to spread their freedom hating tentacles through the galaxy, probably trying to regain their former glory. It's actually a little sad when you think about it.
Freedom be with you, Helldiver.
escaped farm animals, but they've been multiplying faster than our regular units can keep up with. But now that the Helldivers are going in, we'll have them under control soon enough.
That was one for the Record Books, where all missions are logged for analysis.
Res is fierce. We can't give up.

Hey, hell Dier want to hear something crazy. I heard that in the old days, every work of art belonged to the artist who made it. Can you imagine.Now, of course, art is all converted to data and then replicated over and over, far more efficient.
Good job shutting down that tower. Few less mutations to worry about.
Helldiver, the ship is ready for emergency warp.
My prediction? The automatons will go the way of the illuminate. Nothing but a memory.
I'm sure we'll find a way to stop the wormhole from catastrophically collapsing and destroying half the galaxy.
Smells like squid guts in here must have been a good mission.
We did it, Hediver, we saved Super Earth, both of us working together.
The DS S S is so large. It's run by 10 shipmasters. Can you imagine.
Those bots didn't stand a chance against you.
I'm sure you've wondered how voting works on a destroyer. Don't worry, our terminal is top of the line. Latest algorithm and everything.
Good luck out there, Helldiver.
With the DSS around, this planet will be free in no time.
Our enemies couldn't take down even a single Helldiver today. You truly are invincible.
Ere there was talk of a strike on prosperity falls, something about their work being replicated without consent. Hopefully they'll crack down on them soon.
We defended Superear. Every member of the crew deserves a commendation, maybe even an approbation.
Welcome back. We will redeem this failure.
Once we get the TCS established, we can start putting the bugs back on the farms, where they belong. With tighter security this time, too.
I have something for you, Helldiver.
A failed mission, but we won't give up.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. I look forward to serving with you.
greetingsï¼Œhelldiver
Good work down there. Could always use more samples, of course.
A temporary setback. We will fight on.
Just in time. Glad you made it out of there.
A triumphant return.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver.
Liberty is victorious once more.
Liberty is an onrushing wave. One obstacle will not stop us.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver, and congratulations on completing your training.
Welcome back, Helldivers. Your comrades who didn't return will rest easy knowing that this mission had a lower than average casualty rate.
Feel free to take a look around. This is your ship after all.
Freedom wins again.
We had reinforcements ready, but you didn't need them. Excellent work.
this crew at risk, but everyone here would gladly give their lives to preserve democracy.
Good work. The squids are probably starting to realize they bit off more than they could chew.
If more planets turn into super colonies like Meridia, we'll have to significantly ramp up our munitions production. We'll need a lot more bombs, is what I'm saying.
hello
High Command has rewarded us.
That was a close one.
Keep an eye out for more samples next time.
We're fighting three fronts, the Terminids on one side, the Automatons on the other, and the Illuminate who seem to be everywhere.
No Helldivers KIA on that mission. This is cause for celebration.
Ammo, fuel, personnel, I manage everything on this ship with one thing in mind, making sure you have the support you need, Helldiver.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver, and congratulations on completing your training.
The bridge is four of here. Talk to the democracy officer when you're ready to join the fight.
The average Helldiver mission approaches the cost of a Liberty class cruiser. Just goes to show how critical our mission is to the war effort.
We will fight on in the memory of those we lost.
I wish I could see the look on the squid's faces, their dead exploded faces.
That was a close one.
in recognition of our contribution to the war effort.
Super earth free, forever.
You secured a lot of samples.
010000001 01001000. That was the first intercepted bot message. Our analysts think it means kill all humans.
hello
The Terminids and Automatons caught us off guard, but we're back on our feet now. And we're not gonna let that happen again.
Freedom be with you, Helldiver.
Welcome aboard, Helldiver. The galactic war needs you.
Many heroes gave their lives to liberty today. They will be remembered.
Freedom wins again.
Let me know if you need anything.
a failed mission. But we won't give up.
Visual scan of deck complete.
